member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ClipMode
member.summary:
Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are.
Clip Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.
Ellipsis Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.
EllipsisWithTooltip Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ClipMode.Clip
member.summary: Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ClipMode.Ellipsis
member.summary: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ClipMode.EllipsisWithTooltip
member.summary: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType
member.summary:
ColumnQueryMode provides options to retrive data from the datasource.
All It retrives whole data source
Schema Retrives data for all the defined columns in grid from the data source.
ExcludeHidden Retrives data only for visible columns of grid from the data source.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType.All
member.summary: Specifies that all columns should be queried from data source.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType.Schema
member.summary: Specifies that only columns specified in the GridColumns component should be queried from data source.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType.ExcludeHidden
member.summary: Specifies that exclude hidden columns specified in the GridColumns should be queried from data source.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.AdaptiveMode
member.summary:
AdaptiveMode Defines the mode of AdaptiveUI layout. The available Adaptive modes are:
Both Default.Render the Adaptive Layout for both mobile and desktop.
Mobile Render the Adaptive Layouts only on the smaller devices.
Desktop Render the Adaptive Layouts only on the desktop.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.AdaptiveMode.Both
member.summary: Default. Render the Adaptive Layout for both mobile and desktop.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.AdaptiveMode.Mobile
member.summary: Render the Adaptive Layouts only on the smaller devices.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.AdaptiveMode.Desktop
member.summary: Render the Adaptive Layouts only on the Desktop.

member.summary:
Defines modes of GridLine, They are.
Both Displays both the horizontal and vertical grid lines.
None No grid lines are displayed.
Horizontal Displays the horizontal grid lines only.
Vertical Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CellSelectionMode
member.summary:
Defines mode of cell selection.
Flow Default. Selects the range of cells between start index and end index that also includes the other cells of the selected rows..
Box Selects the range of cells within the start and end column indexes that includes in between cells of rows within the range

member.summary: Default. All the cells between start and end cell will be selected.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CellSelectionMode.Box
member.summary: Range of cells that match the index of start and end cell will be selected

member.summary: Same as Box, but shows border during selection.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CheckboxSelectionType
member.summary:
Defines type of checkbox selection. This helps to reset selection when CheckboxOnly property is enabled.
Default Default. In this mode, user can select multiple rows by clicking rows one by one.
ResetOnRowClick In ResetOnRowClick mode, on clicking a row it will reset previously selected row and also multiple rows can be selected by using CTRL or SHIFT key.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CheckboxSelectionType.Default
member.summary: Default. Clicking row will not clear selection selection of the row.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CheckboxSelectionType.ResetOnRowClick
member.summary: Clicking row will reset the row selection.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ColumnType
member.summary:
Specifies the column type of the , denoting the type of data it displays.
String A string type column.
Number A number type column. Primitive types such as int, int?, floar, double, decimal etc. are consider as number type column.
Integer A integer type column.
Double A double type column.
Long A Long type column.
Decimal A Decimal type column.
Boolean A boolean type column.
Date A date type column. Primitive types such as datetime and datetimeoffset are consider as date type column.
DateTime A datetime type column. Primitive types such as datetime and datetimeoffset are consider as date type column.
CheckBox Enables checkbox column for selection purpose. No data operation is assosiated with this column.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeBatchAddArgs`1
member.summary: Provides information about an event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeBatchAddArgs`1.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to prevent the rendering of the batch add form in the grid.
member.value: If set to true, the batch add form will not be rendered in the grid. The default value is false

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeBatchAddArgs`1.DefaultData
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for a newly added row.
member.value: The default value is null.
member.remarks: If a custom default value is provided, it will be displayed in the batch add form when a new row is added.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeBatchAddArgs`1.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the primary key value of the grid for the columns that have property set to true.
member.value: A string array that represents the primary key value of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeBatchAddArgs`1.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the row to add a new row in the grid.
member.value: An integer representing the index of the newly added row. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: If the index property is set, a batch add form will be generated in the grid based on the specified index.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeBatchAddArgs`1.EditContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the data related to the editing process, such as flags indicating which fields have been modified and the current set of validation messages.
member.value: An instance of the class that provides data about the editing process.

member.value: The row index of the selected record.
member.remarks: When multiple rows are selected and the delete action is performed, the row index property will contain the index of the last selected row that was deleted.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeCopyPasteEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeCopyPasteEventArgs.Action
member.summary: Gets the current action whether it is Copy or Paste.
member.value: When copy action is performed then the value will be Copy and when paste action is performed then the value will be Paste.
member.remarks: If the Copy action is prevented using Cancel argument, then the corresponding Paste events doesn't trigger, since Paste events will be triggered based on clipboard text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BeforeCopyPasteEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the entire copy, paste action in the grid.
member.value: The default value is false. If the Cancel property is set to true, then the Copy and Paste action will be cancelled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.CellSavedArgs`1.CellInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the CellDOM object associated with the edited cell.
member.value: The CellDOM object that represents the edited cell.
member.remarks:
The CellDOM properties include:
HasChanges: A boolean property that indicates whether the Cell object associated with the edited cell has changed.
ClassList: A property that contains the class list of the edited cell.
Styles: A property that contains the styles of the edited cell.
AttributeList: A property that contains the attribute list of the edited cell.
AddClass: A method to add class names to the class list for the current edited cell.
AddStyle: A method to add styles for the current edited cell.
SetAttribute: A method to set an attribute for the current edited cell.

member.summary: Gets details about the parent row.

member.remarks: Utilizing parent row details, you can customize the detail row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateEventArgs`1.RowInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for the detail template.
member.value: This property contains information about detail content, such as images, text, hyperlinks, or grids.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateRowSettings.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of columns in the detail rows.
member.value: The default value could be null.
member.remarks: If the column count property is not specified, it will be determined based on the Headers and Rows of the first row's cell count. If the column count is less than the cell count, it will be considered as the row's cell count instead of the column count.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateRowSettings.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image details of the current cell.
member.value: An object represents image details such as ImageStream, width, and height etc.., You can customize and export image using this Image property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateRowSettings.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets the PdfGrid header content of the detail row which includes stacked headers too.
member.value: A collection of objects representing header content.
member.remarks: This property is utilized to render the hierarchical grid structure, which includes headers. It can render multi-level stacked headers if the detail grid has them; otherwise, there is no need to define value for this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateRowSettings.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of PdfGrid content rows for the corresponding detail row.
member.value: A list of PdfDetailTemplateRow objects representing content for the detail row.
member.remarks: This property is utilized to render the hierarchical grid structure; otherwise, there is no need to define value for this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateRow.Cells
member.summary: Represents a list of cells within the header or content rows of a detail row in the PDF document.
member.value: A list of objects representing cells in the header or content rows of detail rows in the PDF document.
member.remarks: These cells can contain various types of values, including text, images, hyperlinks, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateRow.ChildRowInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the nested level information of detail row, when parent row has nested level hierarchical structure.
member.value: An instance of containing nested level values.
member.remarks: Use this property if a complex level hierarchy structure needs to be rendered; otherwise, it is not needed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateCell.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the PDF cell.
member.value: The object associated with the theme style for the current cell. Use the Style property to customize the cell's appearance.
member.remarks: By default, it applies the parent grid header style for Headers and content styles for Rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfDetailTemplateCell.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image details of the current cell.
member.value: An object represents image details such as ImageStream, width, and height etc.., You can customize and export image using this Image property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FailureEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about an event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FailureEventArgs.Error
member.summary: Gets the error information associated with an action.
member.value: An Exception object that provides details about the error that occurred during an action.
member.remarks: The Error property is typically used in error-handling scenarios to retrieve information about an error that occurred during the execution of an operation or task. When an exception occurs, the .NET runtime automatically creates an Exception object to encapsulate information about the error, such as the error message, the type of exception, and the stack trace. You can use the Error property to retrieve this Exception object and access its properties and methods to obtain more detailed information about the error.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfHeaderFooterContent.TextDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the tion of the PDF header and footer content. It allows changing the text direction.
member.value: One of the values in the enumeration that specifies the text direction. The default value is .
member.remarks:
The PdfTextDirection property can be set to one of the following values:
None: Content is displayed without any shaping or formatting based on languages. For example, the content Welcome to Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙƒÙÙŠÙˆØ¬Ù† products will be rendered as Welcome to Ù†Ø¬ÙˆÙŠÙÙƒÙ†ÙŠØ³ products
LeftToRight: Content is shaping based on language and the reading order of content is from left to right. For example, the content Welcome to Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙƒÙÙŠÙˆØ¬Ù† products will be rendered as Welcome to Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙƒÙÙŠÙˆØ¬Ù† products
RightToLeft: Content is shaping based on language and the reading order of content is from right to left. For example, the content Welcome to Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙƒÙÙŠÙˆØ¬Ù† products will be rendered as products Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙƒÙÙŠÙˆØ¬Ù† Welcome to

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "PdfExport" })" AllowPdfExport="true">
             <GridEvents OnToolbarClick="ToolbarClickHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
             </SfGrid>
            @code{
             SfGrid<BusinessObject> Grid;
             public List<PdfHeaderFooterContent> HeaderContent = new List<PdfHeaderFooterContent>
             {
                  new PdfHeaderFooterContent() { TextDirection = Syncfusion.PdfExport.PdfTextDirection.RightToLeft, Type = ContentType.Text, Value = "Welcome to Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙƒÙÙŠÙˆØ¬Ù† products", Position = new PdfPosition() { X = 300, Y = 50 }},
             }
             public async Task ToolbarClickHandler(Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ClickEventArgs args)
             {
             if (args.Item.Text == "PDF Export")
             {
                      PdfExportProperties ExportProperties = new PdfExportProperties();
                      PdfHeader Header = new PdfHeader()
                      {
                               Contents = HeaderContent,
                      };
                      ExportProperties.Header = Header;
                      await this.Grid.PdfExport(ExportProperties);
             }
             }

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the row drop action.
member.value: true, if the drop action is cancelled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.summary: Gets the collection of row data associated with a dropped action in the grid.
member.value: A of row data associated with the dropped action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppingEventArgs`1.Action
member.summary: Gets the current action, either "Add" or "Delete", when dragging and dropping rows between two grids.
member.value: A value that represents the current action. Possible values are "Add" if the collection of row data was added to the destination grid, and "Delete" if the collection of row data was removed from the source grid.
member.remarks: The value of the Action property will be null when performing drag and drop operations within the same grid. This property is set and updated when the event is triggered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppingEventArgs`1.FromIndex
member.summary: Gets the row index of the row associated with the drag start action.
member.value: An integer value representing the index of the row associated with the drag start action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppingEventArgs`1.DropIndex
member.summary: Gets the row index of the row associated with the drop action.
member.value: An integer value representing the index of the row associated with the drop action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppingEventArgs`1.Target
member.summary: Gets the target element's ID and its XPath.
member.value: ID, returns ID of the target element. If there is no ID for the target element then the value for the ID will be empty string(ID= "") XPath, XPath of the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppingEventArgs`1.TargetDimension
member.summary: Gets the dimensions of the target element.
member.remarks:
The contains the following dimensions:
LeftThe left position of the target element.
RightThe right position of the target element.
TopThe top position of the target element.
BottomThe bottom position of the target element.
HeightThe height of the target element.
WidthThe width of the target element.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppedEventArgs`1
member.summary: Provides information about the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowDroppedEventArgs`1.Action
member.summary: Gets the current action performed during drag and drop between two grids.
member.value:
The current action can be one of the following:
Add - The row data is added to the destination grid.
Delete - The row data is removed from the source grid.
member.remarks: The value of the property will be null when the drag and drop operation occurs within the same grid and the event is triggered.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the sorting action.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: The Cancel property is used to control the sorting action of the grid. If the Cancel property is set to true, then the sorting action will be Canceled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortingEventArgs.IsCtrlKeyPressed

member.value: true if the CTRL key is pressed for multi-sorting; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortedEventArgs.Action
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the sorting action.
member.value: Add sorts the grid data based on the specified column and direction. Remove Removes sorting from the specified column. Replace when the sort column direction changes from Ascending to Descending or vice versa for the same column. Reset Clears sorting from all columns in the grid using Method.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortedEventArgs.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets the field name of the column which is associated with sorting.
member.value: The string value that represents the field name of column which is associated with sorting.
member.remarks: This property returns the field name of the column currently associated with sorting, even in cases of multi-sorting.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortedEventArgs.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the sorted column.
member.remarks: The available sort directions are: SortDirection.None: Default, no sorting is applied or when sorting is removed. SortDirection.Ascending: Sorts records in ascending order. SortDirection.Descending: Sorts records in descending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortedEventArgs.SortedColumns
member.summary: Gets the list of sorted columns field name and it's sort direction.
member.value: The list of objects. By default, it is null.
member.remarks: The list of sorted columns field name and it's sort direction will be available when columns are sorted using method.

member.value: The default value is false. If the Cancel property is set to true, then the edit action will be Canceled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.OnRowEditStartEventArgs.PreventDataClone
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to clone data object during editing. Set the property when the event is triggered.
member.value: A Boolean value that indicates whether the data object should be cloned or not when editing begins. true: A clone of the data object will not be created, and the original data object is used for editing. false: A clone of the data object will be created and used for editing instead of the original data object. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If PreventDataClone is set to true, the edited data will be saved even if the user discards the changes using the Cancel button in the toolbar or dialog editing cancel button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.RowEditedEventArgs`1.Data

member.remarks: By default, this property is cloned, which means the original data will be reverted even if the user discards the edited data using the Cancel button in the toolbar or dialog editing cancel button. To prevent this cloning, you can set the PreventDataClone argument of the event to true. This event is triggered before the current event.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FilteringEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FilteringEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the filtering or clear filtering action in the grid.
member.value: The default value is false. If the Cancel property is set to true, then the filtering action or clear filtering action will be canceled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FilteringEventArgs.PreventFilterQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to prevent the grid columnâ€™s default filter query during the API call.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, when a filter is applied to a grid column, the grid sends a default filter request with the column name and filter value to the server. In some cases, the default filter request may be too long and exceed URL length limitations, resulting in a long URI exception. This property provides an option to generate a custom filter query for a specific grid column and override the default filter request. To utilize this property, set it to true within this event, and then override the ProcessCustomFilterQuery method in the adapter.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FilteredEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.FilteredEventArgs.FilterPredicates
member.summary: Gets the list of objects containing filter predicate model details currently associated with filtering.
member.value: A list of objects representing filter predicate model details currently associated with filtering.
member.remarks: This property holds a collection of filter predicate values for a column currently undergoing filtering. - For filter types such as or , multiple predicate details are included from filtering using checkboxes and custom filters. - For filter types like or , only a single filter predicate detail is present. In essence, this property contains the current filter predicate details when a single or multiple values are filtered for a column. If the filter for a column is removed, the property becomes null. To clear or reset filtering from all columns in the grid, use the method, which results in both the and ColumnName properties becoming null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.Action
member.summary: Gets the CUD (Create, Update, Delete) actions that can be performed when the edit mode is set to or .

value.para: The possible values for this property are:

item.description: Indicates that a new record is being added.
Indicates that an existing record is being edited and saved.
Indicates that an existing record is being deleted.

value.para: The default value of this property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the current action.
member.value: The default value is false, If the Cancel property is set to true, the current action will be cancelled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.PreventDataClone
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to clone data object during editing. Set the property when the event is triggered with RequestType as BeforeBeginEdit.
member.value:
A boolean value that indicates whether the data object should be cloned or not when editing begins. The possible values for this property are:
trueA clone of the data object will not be created and the original data object is used for editing.
falseA clone of the data object will be created and used for editing instead of the original data object.
The default value is false.
member.remarks: If PreventDataClone is set to true, the edited data will be saved even if the user discards the changes using the Cancel button in the toolbar.

member.value: The field name associated with the current column based on the current actions like Grouping, Sorting, and Filtering, for remaining actions the value will be null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.Direction
member.summary: Gets the direction of the sorted column.

The available sort directions are:
SortDirection.Ascending: Default, sorts records in ascending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.ExcelSearchOperator
member.summary: Gets or sets the Excel search operator.
member.value: The enum value that represents the selected search operator.
member.remarks:
Use this property to get or set the operator that will be used to filter data based on Excel-style search criteria. The available operators are specified by the enum. The default value is . The available operators are:
None: No operator is selected. For example, if we set
Contains: Checks whether the value contains the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "an", then the item would contains "an", columns to be filtered.
StartsWith: Checks whether the value begins with the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "an", then the item would startswith "an", columns to be filtered.
EndsWith: Checks whether the value ends with the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "an", then the item would endswith "an", columns to be filtered.
Equal: Checks whether the value is equal to the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "an", then the item would equal to "an", columns to be filtered.
NotEqual: Checks for values not equal to the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "an", then the item would notequal to "an", columns to be filtered.
GreaterThan: Checks whether the value is greater than the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "10", then the item would greaterthan to "10", columns to be filtered.
GreaterThanOrEqual: Checks whether a value is greater than or equal to the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "10", then the item would greaterthan or equal to "10", columns to be filtered.
LesserThan: Checks whether the value is less than the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "10", then the item would lessthan to "10", columns to be filtered.
LesserThanOrEqual: Checks whether the value is less than or equal to the specified value. For example, if we set and the search term is "10", then the item would lessthan or equal to "10", columns to be filtered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.RequestType
member.summary: Gets the current in the grid like sorting, filtering, grouping, and etc.
member.value: The current action being performed in the grid.
member.remarks:
The request type assigned to the grid depends on the actions performed. The available request types include:
Add: When adding a new record in the normal or dialog edit mode enabled DataGrid.
BeforeBeginEdit: Before the current record becomes editable state in the normal or dialog edit mode enabled DataGrid (occurs only in event).
BeginEdit: After the current record becomes editable state in the normal or dialog edit mode enabled DataGrid.
Save: When saving a record in the normal or dialog edit mode enabled DataGrid.
Delete: When deleting a record in the normal or dialog edit mode enabled DataGrid.
Cancel: When canceling an edit operation in the normal or dialog edit mode enabled DataGrid.
Filtering: When filtering data in the DataGrid.
FilterBeforeOpen: Before opening the filter dialog for , and filter types (occurs only in event.).
FilterChoiceRequest: While fetching data to render the filtering checkboxes in or filter type.
FilterAfterOpen: After a filter dialog is opened (occurs only in When a filter dialog is opened. It will assigned only in event).
Sorting: When sorting data in the DataGrid.
Grouping: When grouping data in the DataGrid.
UnGrouping: When ungrouping a column in the DataGrid.
Paging: When navigating pages in the DataGrid.
Reorder: When reordering a column in the DataGrid.
RowDragAndDrop: When dragging and dropping rows in the DataGrid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.Code
member.summary: Gets the string that identifies the physical key being pressed, while saving the edited record using Enter or Tab keys in edit mode.
member.value: Enter, if the Enter key is used to save the edited record. Tab, if the Tab key is pressed from the last edited cell or the 'Shift-Tab', key is pressed from the first edited cell. By default, the value is set to null.
member.remarks: The value of this property is assigned while performing the save operation using Enter or Tab keyboard keys. In this case, will be 'Save', and the will be 'Edit'. If no save operation has been performed, the value of this property will be null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ActionEventArgs`1.IsShiftKeyPressed
member.summary: Gets the boolean value that identifies whether the `Shift-Tab` key was pressed to save the edited record in edit mode.
member.value: true if the `Shift-Tab` key is pressed from the first edited cell, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Corresponding value has been assigned while performing the save operation using `Shift-Tab` keyboard keys, also will be 'Save' and the will be 'Edit'. Otherwise value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.DialogSettings.AnimationEffect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the dialog. If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None.

member.summary: If AllowAdding set to false, then it disables add operation of a particular column. By default all columns are editable.

member.summary: If AllowFiltering set to false, then it disables filtering option and filter bar element of a particular column. By default all columns are filterable.

member.summary: If AllowGrouping set to false, then it disables grouping of a particular column. By default all columns are groupable.

member.summary: If AllowReordering set to false, then it disables reorder of a particular column. By default all columns can be reorder.

member.summary: If AllowResizing set to false, it disables resize option of a particular column.

member.summary: If AllowSorting set to false, then it disables sorting option of a particular column. By default all columns are sortable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AutoFit
member.summary: If AutoFit set to true, then the particular column content width will be adjusted based on its content in the initial rendering itself. Setting this property as true is equivalent to calling AutoFitColumns method in the DataBound event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ClipMode
member.summary:
Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are.
Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.
Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.
Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.summary: The CSS styles and attributes of the content cells of a particular column can be customized.

member.remarks: If no default value is provided then the default value of the model property type will be used as initial value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: If DisableHtmlEncode is set to false, it disables the encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: If DisplayAsCheckBox is set to true, it displays the column value as a check box instead of Boolean value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EditorSettings
member.summary:
Defines the object to customize default cell editors. The following types can be used to customize default editors.
Customizes the default numerictextbox editor.
Customizes the default dropdown editor.
Customizes the default datepicker editor.
Customizes the default checkbox editor.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EditTemplate
member.summary: Defines the cell edit template that used as editor for a particular column.
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type TValue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EditType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of editor component to be rendered in the edit form.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the editor component to be rendered in the edit form. If EditType is not provided then the EditType will inferred from the property type of the TValue. If TValue is ExpandoObject/ DynamicObject, then the EditType will inferred from the first data row. If EditType is not mentioned then the below components will rendered for the corresponding mentioned column types. For String type column, will rendered in the edit form. For Date and DateTime type columns, will rendered in the edit form. For DateOnly type column, will rendered in the edit form. For TimeOnly type column, will rendered in the edit form. For Boolean type column, will rendered in the edit form. For Number type column, will rendered in the edit form.
member.remarks: The EditType property can be set to one of the following values: DefaultEdit: will rendered in the edit form DropDownEdit: will rendered in the edit form. BooleanEdit: will rendered in the edit form. DatePickerEdit: will rendered in the edit form. DateTimePickerEdit: will rendered in the edit form. NumericEdit: will rendered in the edit form. TimePickerEdit: will rendered in the edit form.

example.code: <SfGrid DataSource="@Orders"> <GridColumns> <GridColumn Field=@nameof(Order.Freight) EditType="EditType.NumericEdit" ></GridColumn> </GridColumns> </SfGrid>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EnableGroupByFormat
member.summary: If EnableGroupByFormat set to true, then it groups the particular column by formatted values. By default columns are group by format.

member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. The bounded columns can be sort, filter and group etc., If the Field name contains â€œdotâ€, then it is considered as complex binding.

member.summary: If IsIdentity is set to true, then this column is considered as identity column. This column will be in disabled state in add form.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If IsPrimaryKey is set to true, considers this column as the primary key constraint.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.LockColumn

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.MaxWidth
member.summary: Defines the maximum width of the column in pixel or percentage, which will restrict resizing beyond this pixel or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.MinWidth
member.summary: Defines the minimum width of the column in pixels or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ShowColumnMenu
member.summary: If ShowColumnMenu set to false, then it disable the column menu of a particular column. By default column menu will show for all columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ShowInColumnChooser
member.summary: If ShowInColumnChooser set to false, then hides the particular column in column chooser. By default all columns are displayed in column chooser.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.SortComparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom sort comparer function to implement own sort logic for a particular column. For foreign key column with local data source a sort comparer will be assigned by default to sort it by text(ForeignKeyValue) instead of the underlying field value.
member.remarks: Custom sort comparer cannot be used with remote data and Entity framework data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Template
member.summary: Defines the column template that renders customized element in each cell of the column.
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type TValue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.TextAlign
member.summary: Defines the alignment of the column in both header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Freeze
member.summary: Defines which side the column need to freeze.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the column type of the . It determines how the data in the column will be displayed based on the specified type.
member.value: One of the enumerations that specify the column type. If the column type is not explicitly defined, the Type will be inferred from the property type of TValue. If TValue is ExpandoObject or DynamicObject, the Type will be inferred from the first row of the grid data.
member.remarks: The Type property can be set to one of the following values: String: The column will display the string values in the UI. For example â€œAlfkiâ€, â€œUKâ€. Number: The column will display the numeric values such as int, int?, float, double, decimal etc. For example 2, 2.5, 3.33 Integer: Displays integer values from struct. Example: 5, 123 Double: Displays double values from struct. Example: 3.33, 45.567 Long: Displays long integer values from struct. Example: 255486129307 Decimal: Displays decimal values from struct. Example: 123.45M Boolean: The column will display the boolean values such as true or false. Date and DateTime: The column will display the datetime value from the and struct. DateOnly: The column will display the date value from struct. For example 2/1/2023 TimeOnly: The column will display the time value from struct. For example 11:15 AM CheckBox: Display the checkbox for selection purpose. No data operation is assosiated with this column. This Type property is mainly used for ExpandoObject and DynamicObject.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
              <GridColumns>
             <GridColumn Field=@nameof(Order.OrderDate) Type="ColumnType.DateOnly"></GridColumn>
              </GridColumns>
             </SfGrid>
            @code{
            public class Order
            {
                 public DateOnly? OrderDate { get; set; }
            }
            }

members.member: Below codes added to ignore the specified properties while serialization by JSON.net.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.PreventFilterQuery
member.summary: The value set to the PreventFilterQuery property in OnActionBegin event handler is maintained by using this property. This helps to prevent the default filter query generation for previously filtered columns during the multiple column filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ColumnData
member.summary: Provides the data for the grid columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.FrozenMovableLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be displayed whether the column is Left frozen, right frozen and movable column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.NullDisplayText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be displayed when the value of the property is null. This annotation attribute is used for UI display purposes only and does not affect the underlying data source or grid actions.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ConvertEmptyStringToNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether empty string values should be converted to null in UI.
member.value: true if empty string values should be converted to null; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true, if a column has an empty string value, it will be automatically converted to null in the UI. This conversion is specific to the UI and does not affect the underlying data source or other operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be displayed for the tooltip.
member.value: The text to be used as the tooltip content.
member.remarks: By default, the header text is used as the tooltip content. However, if a description is specified in the model's annotation, the description value is applied as the tooltip content instead of the header text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ApplyFormatInEditMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column format should be applied in edit mode.
member.value: true if the format should be applied in edit mode; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true, the specified column format will be applied in edit mode. This allows for consistent formatting of the column value during editing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.IsForeignColumn
member.summary: Returns true if the column is foreign key column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridCommandColumn.Type
member.summary:
Define the command button type.
None Default. A command button with no default action. Use this for custom command actions.
Edit A edit command button that edit current record.
Delete A delete command button that delete current record.
Save A save command button that saves the current edited record.
Cancel A cancel command button that cancels the edit state.
member.remarks: To use custom command button, set Type as and use event to perform custom action.

member.summary: If AllowDeleting is set to true, existing record can be deleted from the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowEditOnDblClick
member.summary: If AllowEditOnDblClick is set to false, Grid will not allow editing of a record on double click.

member.summary: If AllowEditing is set to true, values can be updated in the existing record.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowNextRowEdit
member.summary: If allowNextRowEdit is set to true, editing is done to next row. By default allowNextRowEdit is set to false.

member.summary: Defines the dialog params to edit.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the custom header for the edit dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.Mode
member.summary:
Defines the mode to edit. The available editing modes are:
Normal Default. Editing is done in an inline form. Edit form is rendered inline as one of the table rows.
Dialog Editing is done in a Dialog/Pop component.
Batch Enables cell editing. Multiple cells can be edited, added or deleted and saved.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.NewRowPosition
member.summary:
Defines the position of adding a new row. The available position are:
Top Default. Add form is placed at the first row of the grid.
Bottom Add form is placed at the last row of the grid

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.ShowAddNewRow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display a new blank row during grid initialization, facilitating the addition of new records.
member.value: true, a new blank row is displayed on the grid content. The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, the new blank row is displayed at the top of the grid content. A new blank row can be displayed either at the top or bottom of the corresponding page, depending on the setting of the property. However, it's important to note that the ShowAddNewRow property solely pertains to the display of a new blank row in the editing mode. If the property is set to false, the new blank row will be disabled. Additionally, if any of the grid column's properties is set to false, the corresponding column cell will also be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.ShowConfirmDialog
member.summary: If ShowConfirmDialog is set to false, confirm dialog does not show when batch changes are saved or discarded.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.ShowDeleteConfirmDialog
member.summary: If ShowDeleteConfirmDialog is set to true, confirm dialog will show delete action. You can also cancel delete command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.Template
member.summary: Defines the custom content and edit elements for the edit dialog.
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type TValue of the grid.

member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnActionBegin
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the grid actions such as sorting, paging, grouping, ungrouping, reorder, rowdraganddrop, filtering, add, edit, delete, save and cancel action begins.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object which provides the details of the current grid action. You can differentiate the actions using . To cancel the current action, set the property to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents OnActionBegin="ActionBeginHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void ActionBeginHandler(ActionEventArgs<Order> args)
                {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnActionComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the grid actions such as sorting, paging, grouping, ungrouping, reorder, rowdraganddrop, filtering, add, edit, delete, save and cancel action completed.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object that provides details of the current grid action. An event triggered after the grid action has completed so you cannot prevent the current grid action using .
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents OnActionComplete="ActionCompletedHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void ActionCompletedHandler(ActionEventArgs<Order> args)
                {
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnActionFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised when a grid action fails to achieve the desired results. For example, if the provided URL in the dataSource property is incorrect, it will throw an exception in the event.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object that provides details of the error in the grid, including a stack trace of any exceptions that occurred.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents OnActionFailure="ActionFailureHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void ActionFailureHandler(FailureEventArgs args)
                {
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnBatchAdd
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before new records are added to the UI when a user clicks the add toolbar item or presses the insert key.
member.remarks: This event will be raised only for mode. This event handler receives a object which provides access to the added records and allows for cancellation of the batch add operation using the property. Within this event handler, you can customize the default data that is being added to the grid element before it is added.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEvents OnBatchAdd="BatchAddHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowDeleting="true" AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void BatchAddHandler(BeforeBatchAddArgs<Order> args)
                {
                  args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnBatchDelete
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before records are deleted in the grid element. You can perform delete action by click delete toolbar item or pressing the delete key. If no rows have been selected for deletion, a popup will be displayed allowing the user to select the rows they wish to delete before the operation is performed.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object which provides details of the records to be deleted in Grid. You can prevent the batch delete action by setting the property to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEvents OnBatchDelete="BatchDeleteHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowDeleting="true" AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void BatchDeleteHandler(BeforeBatchDeleteArgs<Order> args)
                {
                  args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnBatchSave
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before batch changes(such as added, edited and deleted data) are saved in dataSource. The edited data can be saved by clicking the Update button on the grid toolbar. When the Update button on the toolbar is clicked, a confirmation popup is displayed to confirm the save action to be performed in the grid.
member.remarks: The property contains the batch changes so that you can customize them within the event handler.. You can prevent the batch save action by setting to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEvents OnBatchSave="BatchSaveHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowDeleting="true" AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void BatchSaveHandler(BeforeBatchSaveArgs<Order> args)
                {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnBatchCancel
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before batch changes are canceled from the grid element. The edited cell will be highlighted in the grid and it will be removed and returned to its original state after canceling the batch action. When the Cancel button on the toolbar is clicked, a confirmation popup is displayed to confirm the cancel action to be performed in the grid.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object which provides the details of the batch changes being canceled. You can customize the cancel action using this event handler. To cancel the this action, set the property to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEvents OnBatchCancel="BatchcancelHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowDeleting="true" AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void BatchcancelHandler(BeforeBatchCancelArgs<Order> args)
                {
                  args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.BeforeCopyPaste
member.summary: An event that is raised before copy or paste action in the Grid cells. You can cancel this entire copy or paste action by using this event.
member.remarks: This event triggers before event, so you can cancel entire pasting operation by using this event. Also, this event handler receives a object which provides the details of before paste/copy action.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" @ref="DefaultGrid" >
             <GridEvents TValue="Orders" BeforeCopyPaste="Copy"></GridEvents>
             ........
             </SfGrid>
             @code{
             public async Task Copy(BeforeCopyPasteEventArgs args)
             {
                  //you can cancel the entire copy action here
                   if(args.Action == "Copy"){
                      args.Cancel = true;
                   }
                 // you can cancel the entire paste action here
                   if(args.Action == "Paste"){
                      args.Cancel = true;
                   }
             }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.BeforeCellPaste
member.summary: An event that is raised before pasting the copied cell value for each cell. You can cancel the pasting action for particular cell or change the value by using this event.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object which provides the details of before pasting the copied cell value in the current cell.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" @ref="DefaultGrid" >
            <GridEvents TValue="Orders" BeforeCellPaste="Paste"></GridEvents>
            ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
            public async Task Paste(BeforeCellPasteEventArgs<Orders> args)
            {
              if(ColumnIndex == 1 && RowIndex == 4){
                  //you can modified the content to be paste here.
                 args.CellValue = "Modified value"; 
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnDataBound
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before data is bound to the grid, allowing you to customize the current view data in this event handler.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object, which contains current view data and total records count.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents OnDataBound="DataBoundHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void void DataBoundHandler(BeforeDataBoundArgs<Order> args)
                {
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnBeginEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised before a row enters edit mode in the UI, such as when a user double-clicks a cell or presses F2 / edit toolbar item to enter edit mode.
member.remarks: This event is raised when as Normal or Dialog. This event handler receives a object, that contains information about the record being edited. This allows you to customize the data before it enters into edit mode. You can prevent the edit action by setting to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents OnBeginEdit="BeginEditHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
                <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowEditing="true" AllowDeleting="true" Mode="EditMode.Normal"></GridEditSettings>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void BeginEditHandler(BeginEditArgs<Order> args)
                {
                    args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnCellEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised before a cell enters edit mode in the UI, such as when a user double-clicks a cell or presses F2 to enter edit mode.
member.remarks: This event is raised when as Batch. Use this event to prevent the edit action by setting to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEvents OnCellEdit="CellEditHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowDeleting="true" AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void CellEditHandler(CellEditArgs<Order> args)
                {
                  args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnCellSave
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before cell changes are updated in the UI. The save action will happen when the cell is in edit state and the user performs an action such as pressing Enter key, clicking or navigating to a new cell.
member.remarks: Within this event handler, you can customize the edited value before update it in grid UI. You can prevent the save action using .
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEvents OnCellSave="CellSaveHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>

                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.CellSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised after a cell is selected in the grid. Cell selection can be done by click on the cell or pressing arrow keys with/without pressing Shift or Ctrl keys or programmatically.
member.remarks: This event is raised when as Cell or Both. The selection of a cell is prevented using the event, then the CellSelected event will not be raised.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents CellSelected="CellselectHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>

                {
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.CellDeselecting
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before any cell deselection occurs in the grid. If a cell is selected and click on to any other cell or pressing Tab or arrow keys without pressing Ctrl or Shift key or programmatically, then the previously selected cell will be deselected.
member.remarks: This event is raised when is set to Cell or Both. You can prevent the cell deselection action by setting to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders">
                <GridEvents CellDeselecting="CellDeselectingHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void CellDeselectingHandler(CellDeselectEventArgs<Order> args)
                {
                  args.Cancel = true;
                }
            }

If a cell is selected and click on to any other cell or pressing Tab or arrow keys without pressing Ctrl or Shift key or programmatically, then the previously selected cell will be deselected.

member.value: An event callback function.

                <GridEvents CellDeselected="CellDeselectHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>

                public void CellDeselectHandler(CellDeselectEventArgs<Order> args)
                {
                }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.OnColumnMenuOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the column menu is opened by clicking the column menu icon in the grid column. This event is also triggered when opening sub-menu items within the column menu.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object, which contains the column menu instance. You can customize the column menu item properties within this event handler. To prevent the default action, set the property to true.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" AllowGrouping="true" AllowFiltering="true" AllowPaging="true" ShowColumnMenu="true">
                <GridEvents OnColumnMenuOpen ="ColumnMenuOpenHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
                public void ColumnMenuOpenHandler(ColumnMenuOpenEventArgs args)
                {
                    args.Cancel = true; // Prevents the column menu from opening
                }
            }

member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" @ref="DefaultGrid" >
            <GridEvents TValue="Orders" BeforeAutoFill="BeforeAutoFillAction"></GridEvents>
            ........
            </SfGrid>

              }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.BeforeAutoFillCell
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that is raised before the autofill action sets the value for each cell. You can cancel the autofill action for particular cell or change the value by using this event.
member.remarks: This event occurs after the event if that event is not canceled. This event handler receives a object which provides the details of before autofill action.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid DataSource="@Orders" @ref="DefaultGrid" >
            <GridEvents TValue="Orders" BeforeAutoFillCell="BeforeAutoFillCellAction"></GridEvents>
            ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
            public async Task BeforeAutoFillCellAction(BeforeAutoFillCellEventArgs<Orders> args)
            {
              if(args.ColumnIndex == 1 && args.RowIndex == 5)
              { 
                  //you can modified the content to be paste here.
                  args.Value = "Modified Value";
              }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.BeforeOpenColumnChooser
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the column chooser dialog is open while click the columns icon in the toolbar. The column chooser allows the user to show or hide columns by changing the state of the checkbox.
member.remarks: This event handler receives a object which provide details about . You can customize the column chooser dialog elements using this event. You can prevent the column chooser action using cref="Syncfusion.Blazor.Grid.GridEvents.ColumnChooserEventArgs.Cancel"/>.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid ShowColumnChooser="true" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "ColumnChooser" })">
              <GridEvents BeforeOpenColumnChooser="BeforeOpenColumnChooserHandler" TValue="Order"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
             public void BeforeOpenColumnChooserHandler(ColumnChooserEventArgs Args)
             {
                args.Cancel = true;
             }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.PdfDetailTemplateExporting
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before a detail template is append to Pdf file format.
member.remarks: This event will be triggered only when the PdfDetailRowMode is set to Expand in . This event handler receives a object, which provides details about the corresponding parent row, along with additional customization options for the PDF detail template. Within this event handler, you can customize the appearance and content of the PDF document before a detail template added. Additionally, this event supports achieving nested grid exporting.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid AllowPdfExport="true" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "PdfExport" })">

            </SfGrid>

             {
              if (Args.Item.Text == "PDF Export")
              {
               await this.Grid.PdfExport();
              }
             }
             public void PdfDetailTemplateEventHandler(PdfDetailTemplateEventArgs<Order> args)
             {
             }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridEvents`1.ExcelDetailTemplateExporting
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before a detail template is appended to an Excel sheet.
member.remarks: This event will be triggered only when the is set to Expand or Collapse in . This event handler receives a object, which provides details about the corresponding parent row along with additional customization options for the Excel detail template. Within this event handler, you can customize the appearance and content of the exported Excel file before a detail template added. Additionally, this event supports achieving nested grid exporting.
member.value: An event callback function.

example.code:
<SfGrid>
              <GridEvents ExcelDetailTemplateExporting="ExcelDetailTemplateEventHandler" OnToolbarClick="ToolbarClickHandler" TValue="BusinessObject"></GridEvents>
            </SfGrid>
            @code {
             SfGrid<BusinessObject> Grid;
             public async Task ToolbarClickHandler(Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ClickEventArgs Args)
             {
              if (Args.Item.Text == "Excel Export")
              {
               ExcelExportProperties ExportProperties = new ExcelExportProperties();
               ExportProperties.ExcelDetailRowMode = ExcelDetailRowMode.Expand;
               await this.Grid.ExcelExport(ExportProperties);
              }
             }
             public void ExcelDetailTemplateEventHandler(ExcelDetailTemplateEventArgs<Order> args)
             {
               . . . .
             }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn
member.summary: Configures grid filter column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of the filter column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent is set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.MatchCase
member.summary: If match case set to true, then filter records with exact match or else filter records with case insensitive(uppercase and lowercase letters treated as same).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Operator
member.summary: Defines the operator to filter records.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.RawInputValue
member.summary: Defines the RawInputValue to filter records.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Predicate
member.summary: Defines the relationship between one filter query and another by using AND or OR predicate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Uid
member.summary: Defines the UID of filter column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Value
member.summary: Defines the value used to filter records.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.ActualValue
member.summary: Defines the Actual value used to filter records.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.PreventFilterQuery
member.summary: The value set to the PreventFilterQuery property in OnActionBegin event handler is maintained by using this property. This helps to prevent the default filter query generation for previously filtered columns during the multiple column filtering.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumns
member.summary: Configures grid filter columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumns.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumns.Columns
member.summary: Defines the filter column collection. Use component to define filter criteria.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings
member.summary: Configures grid filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.MainParent
member.summary: Defines the parent component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to be filtered at initial rendering of the Grid. You can also get the columns that were currently filtered.
member.remarks: Use component to define filter criteria.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.EnableCaseSensitivity
member.summary: If EnableCaseSensitivity is set to true then searches grid records with exact match based on the filter operator. It will have no effect on number, boolean and Date fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ImmediateModeDelay
member.summary: Defines the time delay (in milliseconds) in filtering records when the Immediate mode of filter bar is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Mode
member.summary:
Defines the filter bar modes. The available options are.
OnEnter Initiate filter operation after Enter key is pressed.
Immediate Initiate filter operation after certain time interval. By default time interval is 1500ms.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Operators
member.summary: The Operators is used to override the default operators in filter menu. This should be defined by type wise (string, number, date and boolean). Based on the column type, this customize operator list will render in filter menu.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ShowFilterBarStatus
member.summary: Shows or hides the filtered status message on the pager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Type
member.summary:
Defines options for filtering type. The available options are.
FilterBar Default. Specifies the filter type as filter bar.
Menu Specifies the filter type as menu.
CheckBox Specifies the filter type as check box.
Excel Specifies the filter type as excel.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings
member.summary: Configures grid grouping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.MainParent
member.summary: Defines the parent component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.AllowReordering
member.summary: If AllowReordering is set to true, Grid allows the grouped elements to be reordered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.CaptionTemplate
member.summary: The Caption Template allows user to display custom group caption.
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the column names to group at initial rendering of the Grid. You can also get the currently grouped columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.DisablePageWiseAggregates
member.summary: If DisablePageWiseAggregates set to true, then the group aggregate value will be calculated from the whole data instead of paged data and two requests will be made for each page when Grid bound with remote service.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowDropArea
member.summary: If ShowDropArea is set to true, the group drop area element will be visible at the top of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowGroupedColumn
member.summary: If ShowGroupedColumn is set to false, it hides the grouped column after grouping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowToggleButton
member.summary: If ShowToggleButton set to true, then the toggle button will be showed in the column headers which can be used to group or ungroup columns by clicking them.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowUngroupButton
member.summary: If ShowUngroupButton set to false, then ungroup button is hidden in dropped element. It can be used to ungroup the grouped column when click on ungroup button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.EnableLazyLoading
member.summary: The Lazy load grouping, allows the Grid to render only the initial level caption rows in collapsed state while grouping. The child rows of each caption will render only when we expand the captions.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridInfiniteScrollSettings
member.summary: Configures grid infinite scrolling.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridInfiniteScrollSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridInfiniteScrollSettings.InitialBlocks
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of blocks to be initially rendered when the Grid is loaded. Each block corresponds to a page size of the Grid, resulting in the rendering of a certain number of tr elements determined by multiplying the initial block size with the page size.
member.value: The default value is 3, indicating that the Grid will display three blocks, which translates to a specific number of tr elements, during the initial rendering.
member.remarks: The InitialBlocks property determines the quantity of blocks, each equivalent to a page size, to display during the first load. Additional blocks will be dynamically loaded as the user scrolls through the Grid. For example, when the bottom of the scrollbar is reached, one block of records will be fetched and loaded to display new set of data's. If the is not explicitly provided, it will be calculated based on the viewport height to ensure an optimal user experience. The InitialBlocks size should be set greater than the viewport height to guarantee a smooth and seamless user experience.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridInfiniteScrollSettings.MaximumBlocks
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of blocks to be rendered in the Grid during scrolling when EnableCache is set to true. This caching mode optimizes performance by storing blocks in a cache for large data sets.
member.value: The default value is 3.
member.remarks: When EnableCache is set to true, the MaximumBlocks property determines the maximum number of blocks to be kept in the cache. Exceeding this limit will remove the oldest blocks from the cache to make space for new ones.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridInfiniteScrollSettings.EnableCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Grid will cache visited blocks of data, allowing reuse of previously loaded block data when revisiting the same block. This reduces the frequency of data requests while navigating through the same block.
member.value: true to enable data caching for visited blocks; false by default.
member.remarks: Enabling this caching mode maintains row elements in the DOM based on the count. If the number of maintained rows exceeds this limit during scrolling, the Grid removes rows from the DOM to accommodate new row elements.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridKeySettings
member.summary: Configures keyboard navigation for grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridKeySettings.MoveLeftCell
member.summary:
Defines the action keys for the left cell movement.
ShiftTab Moves to left cell on pressing Shift+Tab key
ArrowLeft Moves to left cell on pressing left arrow key
ShiftLeft Moves to left cell on pressing shift+left arrow key

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridKeySettings.MoveRightCell
member.summary:
Defines the action keys for the right cell movement.
Tab Moves to right cell on pressing Tab key
ArrowRight Moves to right cell on pressing right arrow key
ShiftRight Moves to right cell on pressing shift+right arrow key

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridKeySettings.MoveUpCell
member.summary:
Defines the action keys for the up cell movement.
ShiftEnter Moves to top cell on pressing Shit+Enter key
ArrowUp Moves to top cell on pressing up arrow key
ShiftUp Moves to top cell on pressing shift+up arrow key

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridKeySettings.MoveDownCell
member.summary:
Defines the action keys for the down cell movement.
Enter Moves to down cell on pressing Enter key
ArrowDown Moves to down cell on pressing down arrow key
ShiftDown Moves to down cell on pressing shift+down arrow key

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings

member.summary: Defines the parent component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.EnableQueryString

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.PageCount
member.summary: Defines the number of pages to be displayed in the pager container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.PageSize
member.summary: Defines the number of records to be displayed per page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.PageSizes
member.summary: If PageSizes set to true or Array of values, It renders DropDownList in the pager which allow us to select pageSize from DropDownList.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.Template
member.summary:
Defines the template which renders customized elements in pager instead of default elements.
The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.EnableExternalMessage
member.summary: Enable or disable the ExternalMessage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.ExternalMessage
member.summary: Defines the pager External message.
