member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridRowDropSettings.TargetID
member.summary: Defines the ID of droppable component on which row drop should occur.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings

member.summary: Defines the parent component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the collection of fields included in search operation. By default, bounded columns of the Grid are included.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.
member.remarks: Ignore accent is supported by remote data alone. IgnoreAccent key will be sent to server and operation should be handled at user level.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.IgnoreCase
member.summary: If IgnoreCase is set to false, searches records that match exactly, else searches records that are case insensitive(uppercase and lowercase letters treated the same).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.Key
member.summary: Specifies the key value to search Grid records at initial rendering. You can also get the current search key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.Operator
member.summary: Defines the operator to search records.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings
member.summary: Configures grid selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.CellSelectionMode
member.summary:
The cell selection modes are flow and box. It requires the to be either cell or both.
Flow Default. Selects the range of cells between start index and end index that also includes the other cells of the selected rows..
Box Selects the range of cells within the start and end column indexes that includes in between cells of rows within the range

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.CheckboxMode
member.summary:
Defines options for checkbox selection Mode. They are,.
Default Default. In this mode, user can select multiple rows by clicking rows one by one.
ResetOnRowClick In ResetOnRowClick mode, on clicking a row it will reset previously selected row and also multiple rows can be selected by using CTRL or SHIFT key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.CheckboxOnly
member.summary: If CheckboxOnly set to true, then the Grid selection is allowed only through checkbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.EnableSimpleMultiRowSelection
member.summary: If EnableSimpleMultiRowSelection set to true, then the user can able to perform multiple row selection with single clicks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.EnableToggle
member.summary: If EnableToggle set to true, then the user can able to perform toggle for the selected row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.Mode
member.summary:
Specifies the selection mode. Available modes are,.
Row Default. Row selection is enabled
Cell Cell selection is enabled.
Both Both Row and Cell selection is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.PersistSelection
member.summary: If PersistSelection set to true, then the Grid selection is persisted on all operations. For persisting selection in the Grid, any one of the column must be enabled as a primary key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.Type
member.summary:
Defines options for selection type. They are.
Single Default. Allows selection of only a row or a cell.
Multiple Allows user to select a multiple rows or cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.AllowDragSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable selection of multiple rows and cells by dragging mouse.
member.value: true, if the row and cell selection enabled when dragging mouse. Otherwise, false.
member.remarks: To perform drag selection in blazor grid, set as should be Multiple.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortColumn
member.summary: Configures grid sort column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortColumn.Direction
member.summary:
Defines the direction of sort column. Available directions are,.
Ascending Default. Sorts records in ascending order.
Descending Sorts records in descending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of sort column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortColumn.IsFromGroup
member.summary: Defines the sorted column whether or from grouping operation.

member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.summary: Gets the sorted columns collection, use component to set initial sort columns.

member.summary: Configures grid sorting.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortSettings.MainParent
member.summary: Defines the parent component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortSettings.AllowUnsort
member.summary: If AllowUnsort set to false the user can not get the grid in unsorted state by clicking the sorted column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridSortSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to sort at initial rendering of Grid. Also user can get current sorted columns, use component to set initial sort columns.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTemplates
member.summary: Configures grid templates.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTemplates.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTemplates.RowTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the row template to customize row elements.
member.remarks: The RowTemplate content must be TD elements and the number of TD elements must match the number of datagrid columns. The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type TValue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTemplates.DetailTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template to customize detail row element.
member.remarks: Use DetailTemplate to render hierarchy grid. It supports N level of nested grids. The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type TValue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTemplates.EmptyRecordTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template to customize empty grid row element.
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTemplates.ToolbarTemplate
member.summary: Render custom toolbar using ToolbarTemplate property. It replaces the in-built toolbar and click actions must be handled in custom toolbar itself.
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTextWrapSettings

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.GridTextWrapSettings.WrapMode
member.summary:

Both Default. Wraps both header and content.
Header Wraps header alone.
Content Wraps content alone.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1
member.summary: Blazor Grid component displays tabular data and it has in-built support for various data binding, editing, sorting and filtering.
member.typeparam: A type which provides schema for the grid component.
member.remarks: TValue is inferred from value of DataSource property if it is bounded with IEnumerable. If data is consumed using SfDataManager then TValue must be assigned explicitly.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AddRecord(`0,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Adds a new record to the Grid. If no data is passed then add form will be showed.
member.param: New record to be added.
Specifies index to add the new record.
member.remarks: GridEditSettings.AllowEditing should be true.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AddRecordAsync(`0,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Adds a new record to the Grid at a specific row index.
member.param: New record to be added. The data should be of the same type as the generic type of the grid.
The index in which the new record is to be added. If no index is provided, the record will be added to the end of the grid.
member.remarks: This method adds the row only if is set to true.

example.code:
<button id="AddRecord" @onclick="AddItem">AddRecord</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task AddItem()
               {
                   var data = new Order() { OrderID = 1000, CustomerID = "ALFKI", OrderDate = new DateTime(1995, 03, 25), Freight = 25.7 * 2) };
                   await grid.AddRecordAsync(data, 1); // pass data and index here.
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ApplyBatchChangesAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.BatchChanges{`0})
member.summary: Updates the Grid component UI with a batch of changes, including new records, edited records, and deleted records.
member.param: It contains the collection of records to add, edit, and delete.
member.remarks: This method is used to make bulk changes to the grid UI when in EditMode.Batch. The edited and newly added records will be visually highlighted in the grid UI, and the highlighting will be cleared once the changes are saved or canceled.
member.value: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result can indicate the success or failure of the batch update operation.

example.code:
<button id="GetData" @onclick="SetData">Apply Batch Changes</button>
             <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
              <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowEditing="true" AllowDeleting="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
              ........
             </SfGrid>
             @code{
                SfGrid<Order> grid;
                private async Task SetData()
                {
                  var batchChanges = new BatchChanges<Order>()
                    {
                        AddedRecords = new List<Order>() { new Order() { OrderID = 1, CustomerID = "ANTAR" } }, DeletedRecords = new List<Order>() { new Order() { OrderID = 1002 } }, ChangedRecords = new List<Order>() { new Order() { OrderID = 1001, CustomerID = "VINET" } } 
                    }
                   await grid.ApplyBatchChangesAsync(batchChanges);
                }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AutoFitColumns
member.summary: Changes the column width to automatically fit its content to ensure that the width shows the content without wrapping/hiding. This method ignores the hidden columns. Use the AutoFitColumns method in the DataBound event to resize at initial rendering or use GridColumn.IsAutoFit to set inital auto fit.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AutoFitColumnsAsync
member.summary: Changes the column width to automatically fit its content and ensure that the content is not wrapped or hidden. This method will ignore any hidden columns.
member.remarks: You can use this method in the event or set the property to autofit the columns at initial rendering.

example.code:
<button id="AutoFit" @onclick="AutoFit">AutoFit Column</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="Grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> Grid;
               private async Task AutoFit()
               {
                  await grid.AutoFitColumnsAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AddRecord

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AddRecordAsync
member.summary: A new row with input fields is rendered in grid content, for user to fill the fields and then to save the new record.
member.remarks: This method opens a form with input fields to add a new record to the grid. The new record will only be added if is set to true.

example.code:
<button id="AddRecord" @onclick="AddRecord">AddItem</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task AddRecord()
               {
                 await grid.AddRecordAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AutoFitColumns(System.String[])
member.summary: Changes the column width to automatically fit its content to ensure that the width shows the content without wrapping/hiding. This method ignores the hidden columns. Use the AutoFitColumns method in the DataBound event to resize at initial rendering or use GridColumn.IsAutoFit to set inital auto fit.
member.param: A collection of field names to be autofitted.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AutoFitColumnsAsync(System.String[])
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the width of specified columns to fit their content, without wrapping or hiding.
member.param: An array of columns to be auto fitted, identified by their property.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Hidden columns are ignored for this autofit process. You can use this method in the event or set the property to autofit the columns at initial rendering. If is true, the current autofit state of the columns will be persisted across page refreshes.

example.code:
<button id="AutoFit" @onclick="AutoFit">AutoFit Column</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="Grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> Grid;
               private async Task AutoFit()
               {
                  string[] Columns = { "OrderID", "CustomerID", "Freight" };
                  await grid.AutoFitColumnsAsync(Columns);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AutoFitColumns(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the column width to automatically fit its content to ensure that the width shows the content without wrapping This method ignores the hidden columns. Use the AutoFitColumns method in the DataBound event to resize at initial rendering or use GridColumn.IsAutoFit to set inital auto fit.
member.param: A single field name to be autofitted.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AutoFitColumnAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the width of a specified column to fit its content, without wrapping. Hidden columns are ignored.
member.param: The name of the column to be auto fitted, identified by its property.
member.remarks: You can use this method in the event or set the property to autofit the columns at initial rendering.

example.code:
<button id="AutoFitColumn" @onclick="AutoFitColumn">AutoFitColumn</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task AutoFitColumn()
               {
                  string columnField = "OrderID";
                  await grid.AutoFitColumnAsync(columnField);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Copy(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Copy the selected rows or cells data into clipboard.
member.param: Copies along with column header names.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.CopyAsync(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Copies the selected rows or cells data into the clipboard.
member.param: A nullable Boolean value that determines whether to copy the data along with the column header names. The default value is null.
member.remarks: This method is used to copy the selected data in the grid to the clipboard. The data can either include the column header names or not, depending on the value of the withHeader parameter.

example.code:
<button id="copy" @onclick="Copy">Copy</button>
            <button id="copyWithHeader" @onclick="CopyWithHeader">Copy With Header</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task Copy()
               {
                    await grid.Copy();  // Copies the selected rows or cells
               }
               private async Task CopyWithHeader()
               {
                    await grid.Copy(true); // Copies the selected rows or cells with header
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ExportToCsvAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Exports the grid data to a CSV file.
member.param: An object of type , provides properties to customize the column, data source, theme, etc. for the exported CSV file. If not provided, default values will be used.
A nullable boolean value indicating whether multi-export is enabled or not. This parameter is optional.
An object type that represents the workbook instance. This parameter is optional.
A nullable boolean value indicating if the CSV should be exported as a blob instead of writing it to the response. This parameter is optional.
member.remarks: AllowExcelExport property must be true to use this feature. excelExportProperties object can be used to customize the appearance of the exported CSV file. If not provided, this method will use default values.

example.code:
<button id="ExportToCsv" @onclick="ExportHandler">ExportToCsv</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" AllowExcelExport="true" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task ExportHandler()
               {
                   Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties ExportProperties = new Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties();
                   ExportProperties.ExportType = Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExportType.CurrentPage; // here we have changed the ExportType from AllPages to CurrentPage, as like same we can change our desire properties.
                   await grid.ExportToCsvAsync(ExportProperties);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DeleteRecord
member.summary: Delete a record with Given options. If fieldname and data is not given then grid will delete the selected record. EditSettings.AllowDeleting should be true.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DeleteRecordAsync
member.summary: Deletes the currently selected record from the grid.
member.remarks: This method will only delete a record if is set to true. If no records are selected, it will display an alert message with key DeleteAlert. If is set to true, it will display a confirm dialog before deleting the record with key DeleteConfirmAlert.

example.code:
<button id="DeleteRecords" @onclick="DeleteRecords">DeleteRecords</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
            <GridEditSettings AllowDeleting="true"></GridEditSettings>
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task DeleteRecords()
               {
                  await grid.DeleteRecordAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DeleteRecord(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Delete a record with Given options. If fieldname and data is not given then grid will delete the selected record. EditSettings.AllowDeleting should be true.
member.param: Primary key field name.
Data to be deleted.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DeleteRecordAsync(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Deletes a record in the grid by providing a column name and data.
member.param: The primary key column name of the record to be deleted, identified by its property.
The data of the record to be deleted.
member.remarks: This method will only delete a record if is set to true. If fieldName and data is not provided and no records are selected, then it will display an alert message with key DeleteAlert while calling this method. If is set to true, it will display a confirm dialog before deleting the record with key DeleteConfirmAlert.

example.code:
<button id="DeleteRecords" @onclick="DeleteRecords">DeleteRecords</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
            <GridEditSettings AllowDeleting="true"></GridEditSettings>
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
                var data = new Order() { OrderID = 1006, CustomerID = "ALFKI", OrderDate = new DateTime(1995, 05, 15), Freight = 25.7 * 2 };
               private async Task DeleteRecords()
               {
                  await grid.DeleteRecordAsync("OrderID", data);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EditCell(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Changes a particular cell into edited state based on the row index and field name provided in the Batch mode.
member.param: Row index to be edited.
Column field to be edited.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EditCellAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Change a particular cell into an edited state by providing the row index and field name in mode.
member.param: The index of the row to be edited.
The column name of the cell to be edited, identified by its property.
member.remarks: This method will only edit the cell if the is set to EditMode.Batch and is set to true. It will search for the row and cell based on the provided index and fieldName, and call EditModule.EditCell to edit the cell.

example.code:
<button id="editCell" @onclick="EditCell">EditCell</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
            <GridEditSettings AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task EditCell()
               {
                 await grid.EditCellAsync(3, "CustomerID");
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableToolbarItems(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables ToolBar items.
member.param: ID of toolbar items to be enabled or disabled.
Specifies whether enable or disable.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableToolbarItemsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables toolbar items by identified their IDs.
member.param: A list of strings containing the IDs of toolbar items to enable or disable.
Specifies whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the toolbar items.
member.remarks: This method enables or disables the specified toolbar items by adding or updating their key-value pairs.

example.code:
<button id="EnableToolbarItems" @onclick="ToolbarHandler">EnableToolbarItems</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders" Toolbar="@(new List<string>() { "Add", "Edit", "Delete", "Update", "Cancel" })">
            <GridEditSettings AllowEditing="true" AllowAdding="true" AllowDeleting="true"/>
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task ToolbarHandler()
               {
            	await grid.EnableToolbarItemsAsync(new List<string>() { "Add" , "Edit"}, false); // here we disabled the Add and Edit toolbar items.
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ExcelExport(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Export Grid data to Excel file(.xlsx).
member.param: Provides the excel export properties. Use this to provide custom column, data source, theme etc.
Specifies multi-export is enabled.
Workbook instance.
Export as blob instead of writing response.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ExportToExcelAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Exports Grid data to an Excel file(.xlsx).
member.param: Provides the excel export properties such as custom columns, data sources, themes, etc.
Specifies whether multi-export is enabled or not. This parameter is optional.
The workbook instance to use for the export. This parameter is optional
Specifies whether to export as a blob instead of writing the response. This parameter is optional.
member.remarks: This method exports the data from the current Grid instance to an Excel file. The exported file will be in the .xlsx format.

example.code:
<button id="ExportToExcel<"@onclick="ExportHandler">ExportToExcel<</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" AllowExcelExport="true" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task ExportHandler()
               {
                   Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties ExportProperties = new Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExcelExportProperties();
                   ExportProperties.ExportType = Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExportType.CurrentPage; // here we have changed the ExportType from AllPages to CurrentPage, as like same we can change our desire properties.
                   await grid.ExportToExcel(ExportProperties);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FilterByColumn(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Filters grid row by column name with the given options.
member.param: Specifies the field name to be filtered.
Sepcifies the filter operator.
Specifies the filter value.
Specifies predicate/condition such as AND/OR while filtering multiple value.
Specifies the match case.
Specifies the ignore accent.
Specifies the actual value.
Specifies the actual type.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FilterByColumnAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Filters the grid row by a specified column with the given options.
member.param: The name of the column to be filtered, identified by its property.
The operator to apply to the filter, refer to the operator list in .
The value to use for filtering.
The predicate is used to generate the filter query to meet the multiple filtering requests. This parameter is optional.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the filter should be case-sensitive. This parameter is optional.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the filter should ignore accents when comparing values. This parameter is optional.
Specifies the actual filter value as defined in the corresponding data type. This parameter is optional.
Specifies the actual operator to apply to the filter, as defined in the corresponding data type. This parameter is optional.
Selects the appropriate column when multiple foreign key columns have the same fieldName. This parameter is optional.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous filtering operation.

example.code:
<button id="FilterByColumn" @onclick="FilterHandler">FilterByColumn</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" AllowFiltering="true" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
                 SfGrid<Order> grid;
                 private async Task FilterHandler()
                 {
            	await grid.FilterByColumnAsync("CustomerID", "equal", "ANANTR");
                 }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GetBatchChanges
member.summary: Gets the added, edited,and deleted data before bulk save to the DataSource in batch mode.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GetBatchChangesAsync
member.summary: Gets the added, edited, and deleted data before bulk save to the data Source in mode.
member.remarks: This method should be used when making bulk changes to the data source in EditMode.Batch to allow for review and modification of the changes before they are committed to the data source. The edited and new added records are highlighted in grid UI. It will cleared once we saved the updated changes in the grid.

example.code:
<button id="GetData" @onclick="GetData">Get Data</button>
             <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
              <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowEditing="true" AllowDeleting="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
              ........
             </SfGrid>
             @code{
                SfGrid<Order> grid;
                private async Task GetData()
                {
                  var Data = await grid.GetBatchChangesAsync();
                }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GetColumnByField(System.String)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GetColumnByFieldAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Column details based on the specific column field name.
member.param: The field name of the column to retrieve, identified by its property.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation that returns the with the specified fieldName.
member.remarks: This method searches through all columns in the grid and returns the first column whose field name matches the specified fieldName parameter. If no column is found with the specified fieldName, this method returns null. Case-insensitive search is used while comparing the field name.

example.code:
<button id="getColumns" @onclick="GetColumn">Get Column</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               List<string> listItems = new List<string>();
               private async Task GetColumn()
               {
                    var Column = await grid.GetColumnByFieldAsync("CustomerID");
               }
            }

member.summary: Gets the unique identifier (UID) by its column field name.
member.param: The field name of the column whose unique identifier (UID) is to be retrieved, identified by its property.
member.remarks: This method searches through all columns in the grid and returns the UID of the first column whose field name matches the specified fieldName parameter. If no column is found, this method returns null. Case-insensitive search is used while comparing the field name.

example.code:
<button id="GetUidByColumnField" @onclick="GetDataHandler">GetUidByColumnField</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task GetDataHandler()
               {
                    var Uid = await grid.GetUidByColumnFieldAsync("CustomerID");  //pass column name here
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GroupCollapseAll
member.summary: Collapses all the grouped rows of the Grid.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.CollapseAllGroupAsync
member.summary: Collapses all the currently expanded grouped rows in the Grid.
member.remarks: This method will only Collapse all the grouped rows if is set to true. If the property is true, this method collapses all groups and refreshes the grid data. If the property is true, this method sets the VirtualScrollModule.GeneratedGroupedRows property to an empty list and call the DataProcess method. If the property is true, this method resets the current page to the first page using the and call the DataProcess method. If the property is false, this method collapses all groups by setting their visibility to false and setting their IsExpand property to false.

example.code:
<button id="Collapse" @onclick="CollapseGroup">CollapseGroup</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders" AllowGrouping="true">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task CollapseGroup()
               {
                 await grid.CollapseAllGroupAsync();
               }
            }

member.summary: Expand all grouped rows in the Grid.
member.remarks: This method will only expand grouped rows if is set to true. If GroupSettings.EnableLazyLoading is set to true, it will set IsLazyExpandAll to true and call DataProcess method. Otherwise, it will set IsExpand property to true for all grouped rows and update the grid accordingly.

<button id="ExpandAll" @onclick="ExpandAll">ExpandAll</button>

            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;

               {

               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.IsDirtyAsync
member.summary: Determines whether the grid has any batch changes before updating it.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation. It returns true if the grid has any batch changes, such as adding new records, edited records, and deleted records; otherwise, returns false.
member.remarks: This method will only work if the edit is set to .

example.code:
<button id="UpdateData" @onclick="UpdateData">UpdateData</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowEditing="true" AllowDeleting="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task UpdateData()
               {
                    bool isDirty = await grid.IsDirtyAsync(); // if the grid has any batch changes, it returns true; otherwise, false.
                    if(isDirty)
                    {
                        // You can customized code here.
                    }
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.PdfExport(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfExportProperties,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Export Grid data to PDF document.
member.param: Provides the pdf export properties. Use this to provide custom column, data source, theme etc.
Specifies multi-export is enabled.
PDF document instance.
Export as blob instead of writing response.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ExportToPdfAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfExportProperties,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Export Grid data to PDF document.
member.param: Provides the pdf export properties such as custom columns, data sources, themes, etc.
Specifies whether multi-export is enabled or not. This parameter is optional.
PDF document instance to use for the export. This parameter is optional.
Specifies whether to export as a blob instead of writing the response. This parameter is optional.

example.code:
<button id="ExportToPdf<"@onclick="ExportHandler">ExportToPdf<</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" AllowPdfExport="true" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task ExportHandler()
               {
                   Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfExportProperties ExportProperties = new Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.PdfExportProperties();
                   ExportProperties.ExportType = Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.ExportType.CurrentPage; // here we have changed the ExportType from AllPages to CurrentPage, as like same we can change our desire properties.
                   await grid.ExportToPdfAsync(ExportProperties);
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.UpdateBatchRow(`0)
member.summary: Shows the Edited fields in the batch mode while editing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.UpdateBatchRowAsync(`0)
member.summary: Updates the edited fields in batch mode while editing.
member.param: The data to be updated in the batch mode.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous update operation.
member.remarks: This method updates the cell if the is set to .

example.code:
<button id="UpdateBatchRow" @onclick="DataHandler">UpdateBatchRow</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
            <GridEditSettings AllowAdding="true" AllowEditing="true" Mode="EditMode.Batch"></GridEditSettings>
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task DataHandler()
               {
                    var BatchEdit = await this.grid.GetBatchChangesAsync();
                    List<Order> ChangedRecord = BatchEdit.ChangedRecords.ToList();
                    ChangedRecord[0].Freight = 100;
                    await grid.UpdateBatchRowAsync(ChangedRecord[0]);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ShowColumnsAsync(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Show one or more columns in the grid by their or .
member.param: The list of name of the columns to be shown in the grid.
Specifies whether the column name is shown by its Field or HeaderText. Default value is HeaderText.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation of showing the specified columns in the grid.
member.remarks: You can dynamically show hidden columns in the grid.

example.code:
<button id="ShowColumns" @onclick="ColumnHandler">ShowColumns</button>
            <button id="ShowColumnsByField" @onclick="ColumnFieldHandler">ShowColumnsByField</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task ColumnHandler()
               {
                    var columns = new List<string>() { "Freight", "Ship Country" };
                    await grid.ShowColumnsAsync(columns.ToArray());
               }
               private async Task ColumnFieldHandler()
               {
                    var columns = new List<string>() { "Freight", "ShipCountry" };
                    await grid.ShowColumnsAsync(columns.ToArray(),"Field");   //pass second param as "Field" to show using field name.
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.SortColumnsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SortColumn},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clears the previous sorted columns and sorts a list of columns with the given options.
member.param: A list of the columns to be sorted.
A boolean value that specifies whether to clear the previous sort.
member.returns: representing the asynchronous operation of sorting the columns.
member.remarks: This method will only sort the columns if the is set to true.

example.code:
<button id="SortColumns" @onclick="SortHandler">SortColumns</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" AllowSorting="true" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               public List<SortColumn> sortColumns { get; set; } = new List<SortColumn>();
               private async Task SortHandler()
               {
                    sortColumns.Add(new() { Field = nameof(Order.Freight), Direction = SortDirection.Descending });
                    sortColumns.Add(new() { Field = nameof(Order.ShipCountry), Direction = SortDirection.Ascending});
                    await grid.SortColumnsAsync(sortColumns,true);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ExpandCollapseDetailRowAsync(`0)

member.param: The data of the row by which the detail row will be expanded or collapsed.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous expand or collapse operation.
member.remarks: The given data will be compared against the and if a matching row is found, its detail row will be expanded or collapsed. If the input data and current view data do not have the same reference, use the method.

             ........

               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task RowHandler()
               {
                    var data = new EmployeeData() { EmployeeID = 1, FirstName = "Nancy", LastName = "Davolio", Title = "Sales Representative", HireDate = new DateTime(1995, 05, 15), City = "Seattle", Country = "USA" };
                    await grid.ExpandCollapseDetailRowAsync(data);  
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RefreshScrollLeftPosition
member.summary: Update the scrollLeft value dynamically and refresh the column virtualization enabled grid based on that updated scrollleft value.
member.remarks: This method is mainly used for while resizing a splitter pane when the grid's width is set to auto and is set as true, empty space issue occurs. To prevent this issue, this method updates the scroll left value and refreshes the grid.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ScrollIntoViewAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Scroll to specific row or column into view based on the row and column indexes.
member.param: The index of the column to be scrolled.
The index of the row to be scrolled.
The height of the row that specfies the row offsetHeight and used to calculate the scroll offset values. This parameter is applicable only when row virtualization enabled.
member.remarks: To scroll the grid content horizontally based on the specified column index, set property in the Blazor Grid. To scroll the grid content vertically based on the specified row index, set property in the Blazor Grid.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous scroll operation.

example.code:
<button id="ScrollIntoView" @onclick="Scroll">ScrollIntoView</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
               SfGrid<Order> grid;
               private async Task Scroll()
               {
                   await grid.ScrollIntoViewAsync(2,3);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GetCellValueByIndexAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of a cell in the grid based on row and column indices.
member.param: The index of the row from which to retrieve the cell value.
The index of the column from which to retrieve the cell value.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation that returns the cell value as an object for the specified row and column indices.
member.remarks: This method retrieves the formatted value of a cell from the current view data. When performing grid actions such as sorting, filtering, and grouping, this method returns the current visible data based on the provided indexes When binding a Foreignkey column in the grid, this method returns the Foreignkey value and not the Foreignkey field. The column index represents the index of the column in the Grid UI, not the column order defined in the columns. If the provided row or column index is not valid, null is returned.

example.code:
<button @onclick="GetCellValue">GetCellValue</button>
            <SfGrid @ref="grid" DataSource="@Orders">
             ........
            </SfGrid>
            @code{
                  SfGrid<Order> grid;        
                  private async Task GetCellValue()        
                  {        
                     await grid.GetCellValueByIndexAsync(2,3);    
                  }      
                }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Aggregates
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of instances that control the rendering of aggregate rows displayed in the grid content.
member.value: A list of instances.
member.remarks: The class provides various properties to customize aggregate operations. You can use the class to configure specific aggregate operations for individual columns in the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowExcelExport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to export the grid to an Excel file.
member.value: true, User will export the grid to an Excel file. The default value is false
member.remarks: To perform excel export, bind event and invoke method in its toolbar item click handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the filter bar for all columns in the Syncfusion Blazor DataGrid.
member.value: true, Filter bar will be displayed for all columns and allows the user to filter grid records with required criteria. The default value is false
member.remarks: Filter bar is disabled for template and command column, which means the columns is not having Field property. Filter type can be changed from Filterbar using the property. Filter can be disabled for a particular column by using the property. See for more details.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the user can dynamically group or ungroup columns.
member.value: true, The user can group columns by drag and drop columns from the column header to the group drop area. The default value is false
member.remarks: To disable grouping for a particular column, set the property to false for that column. To programmatically group or ungroup columns, use the and methods. Grouping can be further customized using the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowMultiSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to allow the user to sort multiple columns in the grid.
member.value: true, the user can do the multi sort by clicking on the column header while holding the Shift or Ctrl key. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Note that must be set to true in order to use this property. Sorting can be further configured using the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether paging is enabled for the component.
member.value: true, a pager is rendered at the footer of the grid. The pager can be used to handle page navigation in the grid. The default value is false
member.remarks: Paging can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowPdfExport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifies whether the grid allow users to export grid to PDF document.
member.value: true, The user can export the grid to a PDF document. The default value is false.
member.remarks: To perform pdf export, bind the event and In the toolbar item click handler, invoke the method with required export properties. The export properties can be further customized using the class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowReordering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users can reorder the columns in the grid by dragging and dropping them.
member.value: true, if the grid columns can be reordered. The default value is false
member.remarks: If Grid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user is allowed to resize the columns of the Grid.
member.value: true, Grid columns can be resized by dragging the right edge of the column header. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Resizing can be disabled for a particular column by setting the property to false. In RTL mode, Grid columns can be resized by clicking and dragging the left edge of the header cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowRowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to allow the user to drag and drop grid rows.
member.value: true, Users can drag and drop grid rows at another or within grid. The default value is false.
member.remarks: To drag and drop rows between grids or to another component, you should provide the ID of the target grid or component to the property. Selection feature must be enabled for row drag and drop within grids. Multiple rows can be selected by clicking and dragging inside the grid. For multiple row selection, the property must be set to multiple. For performing row drag and drop action on the data grid, any one of the columns should be defined as a primary key using the property

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Grid records can be selected by clicking on it.
member.value: true, The Grid records can be selected by clicking on it. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Selection can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the grid records are allowed to sort while clicking on the column header.
member.value: true, Grid records can be sorted by clicking on the column header. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Columns in the DataGrid are sorted in ascending order when clicked. Clicking on an already sorted column will toggle the sort direction between ascending and descending. To disable sorting for a particular column, set the property to false. Sorting can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text content in the column cells wraps to the next line when it exceeds the width of the column.
member.value: true, If the text content of the column cells will wrap to the next line when it exceeds the width of the column. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When a column width is not specified, the text wrapping of columns will automatically adjust based on the width of the DataGrid. To further customize text wrapping for specific columns, use the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ClipMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the clip mode to handle content overflow of the Grid cell.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the Clip Mode. The default value is which displays an ellipsis when the content overflows the cell area.
member.remarks:
The ClipMode property can be set to one of the following values:
Clip Truncates the cell content when it overflows the cell area.
Ellipsis Displays an ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.
EllipsisWithTooltip Displays an ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area and displays a tooltip while hovering on the cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ColumnChooserSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance that configures the behavior of the column chooser in the grid.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: The class provides various properties to customize column chooser operations, such as enabling or disabling the column chooser, specifying the column chooser button's text, and setting the position of the column chooser dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.KeySettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the cell movement keys in the grid.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: class provides various properties to customize key operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the column menu items that define both built-in and custom items.
member.value:
The available built-in items are:
AutoFitAll Auto fit the size of all columns.
AutoFit Auto fit the current column.
Group Group by current column.
Ungroup Ungroup by current column.
SortAscending Sort the current column in ascending order.
SortDescending Sort the current column in descending order.
Filter Filter options will show based on FilterSettings property like checkbox filter, excel filter, menu filter.
member.remarks: To disable column menu for a particular column by defining the property as false. To customize the default menu items, define the property with the required items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ColumnQueryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the column query mode for retrieving data from the data source.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks:
The available options are:
All Retrieves the entire data source.
Schema Retrieves data for all the defined columns in the grid from the data source.
ExcludeHidden Retrieves data only for visible columns of the grid from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Columns
member.summary: Defines the schema of the data source for the grid and allows you to add, customize, and remove columns in the grid.
member.value: A list of instances that define the columns in the grid.
member.remarks: The class provides various properties to customize the grid columns, such as setting the column header text, specifying the data field to bind the column to, and formatting the cell values in the column. If the Columns declaration is empty or undefined, the columns are automatically generated from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ContextMenuItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of item to be displayed in the context menu when you right-click on a row or cell in the Grid.
member.value:
The context menu items can be both built-in and custom. The available built-in items are:
AutoFitAll Autofit the size of all columns width.
AutoFit Autofit the current column width.
Group Group by current column.
Ungroup Ungroup by current column.
Edit Edit the current record.
Delete Delete the current record.
Save Save the edited record.
Cancel Cancel the edited state.
Copy Copy the selected records.
PdfExport Export the grid as PDF format.
ExcelExport Export the grid as Excel format.
CsvExport Export the grid as CSV format.
SortAscending Sort the current column in ascending order.
SortDescending Sort the current column in descending order.
FirstPage Go to the first page.
PrevPage Go to the previous page.
LastPage Go to the last page.
NextPage Go to the next page.
member.remarks: You can customize the context menu by providing a template for it using the component. The context menu can also be disabled for specific columns using the property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.CurrentAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the current action details.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for the grid rows.
member.remarks: Use this property to set the data source for the grid. This property expects an IEnumerable of TValue, where TValue represents the type of the data object. To consume data from a remote service or custom adaptor, use the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DataSourceChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets the event that occurs when the data source changes.
member.remarks: Use this event to handle changes to the data source in the grid.This event is raised when the data source is updated or changed. The event handler receives an IEnumerable of TValue, where TValue represents the type of the data object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableAdaptiveUI
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Grid is rendered with a full-screen adaptive UI layout for some grid actions, such as filtering, sorting, and CRUD operations.
member.value: true, The grid is render adaptive dialogs such that they will fit the full screen to provide a better user experience on smaller screen devices. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For rendering the adaptive UI layout in grid only for mobile devices then need to set the property value as "Mobile". Also to view the the rows vertically with headers positioned in the same row instead of at the top then need to set the property value as "Vertical".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AdaptiveUIMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Adaptive mode which used to render Grid component with adaptive UI layout in the specified mode.
member.value: One of the enumeration that specifies the Adaptive Mode. The default value is .
member.remarks:
The AdaptiveMode property can be set to one of the following values:
Both Renders adaptive layout for both mobile and desktop devices.
Mobile Renders adaptive layout only for smaller devices.
Desktop Renders adaptive layout only for desktop devices.
When set to true the Grid is rendered with a full-screen adaptive UI layout for some grid actions, such as filtering, sorting, and CRUD operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EditSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance of that configures the editing behavior of the grid.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: Customize the editing behavior of grid by class provides various properties to configure editing operations, such as allowing or disallowing editing for specific columns, enabling inline or dialog editing, and setting validation rules for edited data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableAltRow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid will render with alternative row styling for improved readability.
member.value: false the grid rows are rendered without any alternative row styling. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When set to true, the grid will apply the e-altrow CSS class to alternative tr element of grid rows. This can be useful for styling alternating rows differently for improved readability. The alternative row styling is customized by simply overriding the e-altrow class in application end.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableAutoFill
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the AutoFill feature is enabled, which allows copying and pasting data from selected cells to other cells by dragging the AutoFill icon.
member.value: true, The auto fill icon will be displayed on cell selection for copying and pasting the data to other cells while dragging the icon. The default value is false.
member.remarks: To use the AutoFill feature, the property must be set to "Cell", the property must be set to "Box", and property must be set as "Batch".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableColumnVirtualization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Grid will render with the columns which are visible within the view-port and load the subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling.
member.value: true, It helps to load large amount of columns in Grid by rendering only the columns that are visible within the view-port and loading subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling. The default value is false.
member.remarks: is required for column virtualization. If is not defined for any of the column then by default 200px is considered for that column. The collapsed or expanded state will persist only for local dataSource while scrolling.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableHeaderFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the first visible header cell will be focused when focus moves to the grid.
member.value: true, The header element will be focused when focus moves to grid. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This property is marked as deprecated, since the first visible header cell will get focused by default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableVirtualMaskRow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the masked row or placeholder until the data's are loaded in the grid during virtualization.
member.value: true the DataGrid will display a masked row when the data is not readily available to show in the grid. The default value is false.
member.remarks: It is must to set EnableVirtualization or EnableColumnVirtualization property value as true to use this mask row feature. The Virtual mask row is supported for column virtualization too.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.OverscanCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of additional items to be render in the DOM before and after the visible items (based on ) during virtual scrolling and initial rendering.
member.value: The number of additional items to pre-render before and after the visible items (based on PageSize). The default value is 0, indicating no overscan.
member.remarks: Adjusting this property can enhance scrolling performance and optimize rendering, especially for large datasets in a virtualized grid. By pre-rendering a buffer of extra items that are not yet visible, the component minimizes the need for frequent re-rendering while scrolling. This optimization results in a smoother and more responsive user experience. If the PageSize is not explicitly provided, it will be calculated based on the viewport height to ensure an optimal user experience.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableHover
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the hovering effect is enabled while hover on the grid rows.
member.value: false, the rows are not highlighted while hover on the grid rows. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When it is set to true, the CSS class "e-hover" will be applied to the row when it is hovered over. This can be used to style the row differently and provide visual feedback to the user. The row hovering style is customized by simply overriding the "e-hover" class in the application end.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates whether enables or disables the persistence of component's state while page reloads.
member.value: true, The grid state such as column order, column width, sort information etc. is stored in the window.localStorage when the component is disposed. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If the property is set for the Grid, then the state will be persisted based on this ID. Otherwise, it will use a default ID. Users can also store grid state in a database instead of the browser's local storage by using the method.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to render the component in right to left (RTL) direction.
member.value: true, the component should rendered in RTL direction. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When the true value is set, the component content will be aligned to the right of the page and the sorting, filtering, and paging icons will be rendered in the right-to-left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableStickyHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the grid header should remain fixed while scrolling the grid content vertically.
member.value: true to make the column headers sticky while scrolling the grid content vertically. The default value is false.
member.remarks: It is suitable only for single headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether virtualization is enabled in the DataGrid which means loads the data in on-demand basis while scrolling the grid vertically.
member.value: true to enable virtualization in the DataGrid. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When set to true, virtualization is enabled, and the DataGrid will load only the rows that are currently visible in the viewport, which can significantly improve the performance and responsiveness of the DataGrid when dealing with large datasets. Subsequent rows will be loaded dynamically as the user scrolls vertically through the DataGrid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FilterSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the filtering behavior of grid.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: class provides various properties to customize filtering operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FrozenColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns to be frozen in the DataGrid.
member.value: The number of columns that need to be frozen in the DataGrid. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: Use this property to freeze a specific number of columns in the DataGrid, so that they remain fixed on the left side of the grid when the user scrolls horizontally through the grid. Note that the frozen columns must be within the view port of the DataGrid in order to be visible. For example, to freeze the first two columns of the grid, you can set the FrozenColumns property to 2. To freeze a specific column, set its property to true and also use the property to set the direction of frozen columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowFreezeLineMoving
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can move the frozen line by dragging and dropping it in the Syncfusion Blazor DataGrid columns.
member.value: true, User can adjust the freeze line. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When this property is enabled, the user can adjust the number of frozen columns by dragging and dropping the freeze bar between columns. If frozen columns are not specified, the frozen column separator will be displayed at the left and right edges of the Grid, and the user can dynamically adjust the number of frozen columns by dragging the separator.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FrozenRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows need to be frozen in the DataGrid.
member.value: The number of rows that needs to be frozen DataGrid. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: The frozen rows will always be displayed at the top of the grid content, and will not move when the user scrolls vertically. Note that the frozen rows must be within the view port of the DataGrid. For example, to freeze the first two rows of the grid, you can set the FrozenRows property to 2.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GridLines
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of border lines of rows and columns in the grid.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks:
The available modes are,
Both Displays both the horizontal and vertical grid lines.
None No grid lines are displayed.
Horizontal Displays the horizontal grid lines only.
Vertical Displays the vertical grid lines only.
Default Displays DataGrid lines based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GroupSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the grouping behavior of grid.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: class provides various properties to customize grouping operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the scrollable height of the grid content.
member.value: The default value is "auto".
member.remarks: You can assign the height using pixel and percentage values such as 100px, 100%, etc. If the height is set to "auto", the grid height will be automatically adjusted based on the number of rows displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.HierarchyPrintMode

member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks:

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.PageSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the pager behavior of grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.PrintMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the hierarchy grid print mode, which defines how the grid and child grids are printed.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks: The available modes are: * Expanded: Prints the master grid with expanded child grids. * All: Prints the master grid with all the child grids. * None: Prints the master grid alone without any child grids.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Query
member.summary: Gets or sets the external query that will be executed along with data processing.
member.value: An instance of class that represents the query parameters that will be sent to the server. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RowDropSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the row drop behavior of grid.
member.value: An instance of .
member.remarks: class provides various properties to customize row drop operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of grid rows.
member.value: The default value is differ based on the theme.
member.remarks: The row height can be specified in pixels or as a percentage of the Grid's overall height. For example, to set the row height to 50 pixels, you can set RowHeight property to 50. To set the row height to 10% of the Grid's overall height, you can set RowHeight property to "10%".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RowRenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the row rendering mode in the grid.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks:
The available modes are:
Horizontal Displays the data rows in horizontal direction.
Vertical Displays the data rows in vertical direction.
The property is rendered on the adaptive layout based on the property. Setting this property value as "Vertical" rows are rendered vertically with headers in the same row which suits better to view grid in small screens. In vertical row rendering mode, limited features are supported like filtering, sorting, dialog editing, selection, searching and row virtualization.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.SearchSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the search behavior of grid.

member.remarks: class provides various properties to customize searching operations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.SelectedRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the row that is selected initially while rendering the grid component.
member.value: The default value is -1. Initially, no rows are selected in the data grid.
member.remarks: This property allows you to select a row at initial rendering. It can also be used to programmatically select a row. You can select a row initially by setting the value of this property to the index of the row to be selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.SelectionSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of which configures the selection behavior of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Toolbar
member.summary: Gets or sets the ToolBar items of the Grid.
member.value:
The available built-in items are:
Add Adds a new record.
Add Adds a new record.
Edit Edits the selected record.
Update Updates the edited record.
Delete Deletes the selected record.
Cancel Cancels the edit state.
Search Searches the records by the given key.
Print Prints the datagrid.
ExcelExport Exports the datagrid to Excel file format.
PdfExport Exports the datagrid to PDF file format.
CsvExport Exports the datagrid to CSV file format.
member.remarks: In some cases, you may want to use a custom toolbar instead of the default one. In such cases, you can use the property to provide a custom toolbar template

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the Grid.
member.value: The default value is "auto".
member.remarks: The property can be assigned with pixel and percentage values such as 100px, 100% etc. When the total column width exceeds the specified value, a horizontal scrollbar will be displayed to allow the user to scroll through the data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableInfiniteScrolling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Grid loads the next set of data's on-demand, when the vertical scrollbar reaches the end of the scroller. This feature enables loading large datasets into the Grid without the need of traditional pagination.
member.value: Set true to enable infinite scroll by loading data when vertical scroll bar reaches the end of scrollbar. The default value is false.
member.remarks: During the initial rendering, the grid loads a block of data based on the property. The default value of InitialBlocks is 3. After that the buffering data's are loaded based on the page size or rows which are rendered within the provided height. Subsequently, as the user scrolls to the end of the grid, additional blocks of data will be loaded in on-demand. In the default Infinite Scrolling mode, a block of data accumulates every time the scrollbar reaches the end. However, in the cache mode, blocks of data are rendered based on the MaximumBlocks setting. If the number of blocks exceeds this limit during scrolling, the Grid removes rows from the DOM to accommodate the new block of data. EnableCache and MaximumBlocks can be configured through the properties of the class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.InfiniteScrollSettings

member.remarks: The class provides various properties to customize the infinite scrolling operation of the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Metadata.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the order weight of the column.
member.remarks: Columns are sorted in increasing order based on the order value. Columns without this attribute have an order value of 0. Negative values are valid and can be used to position a column before all non-negative columns. If an order is not specified, presentation layers should consider using the value 10000. This value lets explicitly-ordered fields be displayed before and after the fields that do not have a specified order.
